intro: Pouteria laeteviridis, commonly known as the green-leafed spondias, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are often used in traditional cuisines. Its leaves are also valued for their medicinal properties. Pouteria laeteviridis thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas.
